      • r

        public static final int r​(int n1,
                          int n2)
        Returns:
        A random number uniformly distributed in [n1, n2] range. It is allowed to have so n1 > n2, or n1 < n2, or n1 == n2.

      • randomize

        public static int randomize​(int sides)
        Used to return numbers that average 0, useful for adding a small random factor to things that would otherwise be boring and 100% predictable. For example, if you input 4, it will return 1d4-1d4, which tends to 0 but could actually return anywhere in the range [-3,+3]. A negative value provided is turned into a positive one for all intents and purposes. An input of zero will also return zero.
        Parameters:
        sides - Given a die X...
        Returns:
        the result of 1dX - 1dX.

      • average

        public static int average​(float dice,
                          float size)
        Useful for handling typical cases in BattleAi-related logic, since it only allows for true randomness in a few key points due to performance considerations. Uses float for parameters since they'd have to be convered anyways.
        Parameters:
        dice - Given this number of dice...
        size - ...and this number of faces per dice...
        Returns:
        ... the most likely outcome of this roll.

      • shuffle

        public static <K extends java.util.List<?>> K shuffle​(K list)
        Returns:
        The same input list, but shuffled with Collections.shuffle(List).

      • pick

        public static <K> K pick​(java.util.Set<K> set)
        Returns:
        Same as pick(List).
